East side market at Houston and Allen Streets. A roast potato vendor is shown in the foreground, supplying luncheon to a group of shopping house wives.
April 28, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A fellow competitor.
1923.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Sweet potatoes.

title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Sweet potatoes.

text:
East Houston Street, at, and adjoining the S.E. corner of Allen Street, showing a 2½-story frame house (at the corner) bearing No. 208 Allen Street. The 4-story house adjoining it is No. 173 East Houston Street. Both houses were later demolished for the widening of Allen Street, where a portion of the Second Ave. Elevated Line is conspicuously visible.

June 21, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

175 to 183 East Houston Street, south side, from Allen (right), east to Orchard Streets. In the foreground is shown construction work on the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway). Also visible (right) is Allen Street, east side, south from East Houston Street. No. 208 Allen Street, a 2 ½-story frame house that stood at this corner in 1927 is now gone. The adjoining building No. 173 East Houston Street was demolished at the same time; both as a part of the widening project of Allen Street.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

175 to 183 East Houston Street, south side, from Allen (right), east to Orchard Streets. In the foreground is shown construction work on the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway). Also visible (right) is Allen Street, east side, south from East Houston Street. No. 208 Allen Street, a 2 ½-story frame house that stood at this corner in 1927 is now gone. The adjoining building No. 173 East Houston Street was demolished at the same time; both as a part of the widening project of Allen Street.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

East Houston Street, south side, east from (No. 181), but not including Allen Street, showing under construction the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway), after houses between East 1st Street (left) and East Houston Street were razed.
June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, another view. On the left appears East 1st Street, south side, east from Allen Street.
June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same (at a slightly earlier date), viewed from a point somewhat eastward.
May 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

East Houston Street, south side, east from (No. 181), but not including Allen Street, showing under construction the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway), after houses between East 1st Street (left) and East Houston Street were razed.
June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, another view. On the left appears East 1st Street, south side, east from Allen Street.
June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same (at a slightly earlier date), viewed from a point somewhat eastward.
May 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

East Houston Street, south side, east from (No. 181), but not including Allen Street, showing under construction the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway), after houses between East 1st Street (left) and East Houston Street were razed.
June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, another view. On the left appears East 1st Street, south side, east from Allen Street.
June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same (at a slightly earlier date), viewed from a point somewhat eastward.
May 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) East Houston Street (where vehicles are seen) east from Allen Street, showing the clearance created between East Houston and East 1st Streets, by the demolition of tenements which faced on the north side of the former and the south side of the latter streets. Note construction going on for the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway). Also shown (left) is East 1st Street, north side, east from (No. 84) but not including First Ave. The cleared area is now (1937) being utilized as a playground.

May 9, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, at a later date, as seen from First Ave. (a continuation of Allen Street), showing a portion of the Second Ave. Elevated Line on Allen Street.

March 13, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) East Houston Street (where vehicles are seen) east from Allen Street, showing the clearance created between East Houston and East 1st Streets, by the demolition of tenements which faced on the north side of the former and the south side of the latter streets. Note construction going on for the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway). Also shown (left) is East 1st Street, north side, east from (No. 84) but not including First Ave. The cleared area is now (1937) being utilized as a playground.

May 9, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, at a later date, as seen from First Ave. (a continuation of Allen Street), showing a portion of the Second Ave. Elevated Line on Allen Street.

March 13, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
